intro: Rochelia disperma, commonly known as the dispersed rochelia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. This plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments, often found in shaded woodland areas. It has a short flowering period, usually in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
